TopicTitle: Reach for orbit with an ion glider!

Articles.Content:
How about once your up to this speed could you detectch the wings as they are not as much use when you get high. Or maybe a whiteknight design?

Getting to orbit, if it's possible at all, will almost certainly require multiple stages. It's possible that a final stage would ditch the wings, but with a maximum TWR of about 0.5 I don't think we've reached the point where that would work yet

I made a slightly better altitude but I have to think something else. I try to keep minimum weight so my plane does not even have wheels. I left them on the ground like this. I try going west next time.
Landing gear, like the small cubic struts, actually doesn't have any weight in the physics
Is FAR allowed?

In the end I did give this ago. My plan is to add a second smaller craft on top and let it go once high up. But not sure if it would work.

Anyway this is my entry for for now.
Sure, I could make separate leaderboards for FAR. I'm curious whether it makes this easier or harder
My guess would be harder. Wings will stall out sooner and the TWR will hurt even more.

Sure, I could make separate leaderboards for FAR. I'm curious whether it makes this easier or harder

At least it will preclude the use of infiniglide
28682 m and 1208 m/s. So the score is 2642.

So ion engines don't get blocked by other engines attached directly behind them? Iiiinteresting. Veeery iiiiinteresting.

Here's my latest attempt:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

33524m, 1430 m/s. I actually ended with both numbers a bit higher, but the screenshot just didn't take.

I think if it's going to be possible, it will have to start off as a very large glider, with a lot of staging to maintain a TWR above 0.5 the whole way
1430 m/s? Wow, we're closing in on orbital velocity!

My latest attempt, ran out of fuel

score is 4063
I'd like to see what that looked like at launch
Seems fairly easy...

I'd like to see what that looked like at launch

Same way as on the pic, its a SSTO

Nice vessels! Zarakon, wow! Two engines only? Gredinus, tree engines? I used four (don't know why).

Good luck to reach orbit! I try improve tomorrow.

I started with 3 engines, dropped one of them along with the first pair of xenon tanks

Grenidus, are you able to post any more pictures of the craft or the flight?

What you're showing there just doesn't seem possible. Are you using any mods, and are you sure you didn't use flapping control surfaces to gain speed?

Nice vessels! Zarakon, wow! Two engines only? Gredinus, tree engines? I used four (don't know why).

Good luck to reach orbit! I try improve tomorrow.

I only used 1 engine and it was a SSTO

High Flyer Leaderboard:

2. zarakon - 3106.2

4. totalitor - 2642.1

1. Tarantulae - 2302.4

3. ttnarg - 1843.3

5. DeMatt - 1681.2

6. cyberklad - 1536.4

7. MaverickSawyer - 1002.6

Can the leaderboard also have the altitude and air speed recorded?

Score = 1921: max orbital speed = 777 m/sec at an altitude of 22,880 m

I gave a multistage ion glider a shot. I ran into a weird aerodynamics issue around 22,000m that forced me to fire the last stage earlier then I would have liked...

I only used 1 engine and it was a SSTO

Are you part clipping or something? I don't see how 2 swept wings, 4 small control surfaces and 1 engine can get as high/fast as you did without infiniglide.
Yeah, I'd like some more details/proof on that flight. It's more than double what anyone else has done with a single engine, and it just doesn't seem possible

Score = 3085: max orbital speed = 1368 m/sec at an altitude of 34350 m.

I made another multistage ion glider: not sure if multistage is better then SSTO, but it's fun for me. I was still gaining speed and altitude at 1368 m/sec and 34350 m, but I lost the sun.

Click here for more images...

Best I can come up with so far.

Massively infini-assisted but that happens when you use small control surfaces as wings. They are the best things to use though as they have the greatest lift to mass ratio of any wing surface.

Edit: It is carrying a Kerbal though!

Edited April 14, 2014 by Redshift OTF
Sorry, the rules say no exploiting infiniglide, keep control surfaces to a minimum
